Jobs In Our Community

  • Civic Technology Fellow

    Metropolitan Area Planning Council

    view listing →

    Lead the development of civic web applications, including services to help the City of Boston's youth jobs program place thousands more local youth into meaningful employment. Work with an inclusive, multidisciplinary team to create 21st century government services, from conception to delivery.

  • New Urban Mechanics Project Manager

    New Urban Mechanics

    view listing →

    With support from Bloomberg Philanthropies, we are building an i-team that uses a research and analysis centered methodology to find new solutions to longstanding challenges. Over the course of its three years, this team will take on at least two major priority areas, starting with housing. The i-team Program Manager will oversee this three-year initiative.

  • Performance Analyst

    City of Boston

    view listing →

    Brief Job Description (essential functions of the job):
    The Performance Analyst is the principal analyst for the City of Boston's performance management program, Boston About Results. Working cross-departmentally, s/he focuses on expanding and strengthening data-driven management citywide. Under the direction of the Citywide Performance Manager and with guidance from the Chief Financial Officer, this person is an essential part of the City's drive to become the most data-driven city in the country by championing the strategic collection, presentation, and use of data that improves government efficiency and effectiveness.

  • Civic Web Developer

    City of Boston

    view listing →

  • Project Lead

    City of Boston

    view listing →

    You will be the day-to-day manager of this project. You will lead the project team, bringing energy, ideas, and inspiration to the effort. You will also make sure the project stays on track and on schedule - working across the City of Boston and the Boston Public Libraries to help the team access data for the project, tap into expertise of City employees, and deploy technology for the catalog.

  • Data Librarian

    City of Boston

    view listing →

    You will bring the expertise of the library world to this project. You will design a model for a data catalog - one that emphasises accessibility, utility, and relatability of data. You will seek user input to ensure we build something truly useful. You will work directly with people across the City to populate the catalog and document our data sets.

  • Library Program Specialist

    City of Boston

    view listing →

    You will develop programs within the Boston Public Libraries that make open data a part of the library offering. You will write reference guides, plan events, and develop training programs that make open data a useful part of the library collection - and help librarians learn how to incorporate open data into their work.

  • DevOps Engineer

    Harvard Library Innovation Lab

    view listing →

    What you will do: Own the production infrastructure that ensures Lab applications are responding quickly to people and bots on the internet. Write code that will monitor systems and develop logic that will automate common deployment and maintenance tasks. Act as a core member of our fun and dynamic team by helping us shape ideas and efforts in libraries, technology, and law. We’re freewheelin’. We fully encourage the pursuit of interests and opportunities.

Looking to post a job? Let us know: hello@codeforboston.org!
